data:
1
00:01:47,320 --> 00:01:49,070
Bingo!

2
00:02:02,800 --> 00:02:04,600
Fucking hell.

3
00:02:06,760 --> 00:02:08,640
Fucking hell.

4
00:02:56,720 --> 00:02:59,280
- Oh, God...
- Keep your shit together.

5
00:02:59,360 --> 00:03:02,320
If you wanna get 'em out of here.

6
00:03:03,120 --> 00:03:05,680
- I can pop these, no problem.
- So get to it!

7
00:03:19,320 --> 00:03:21,710
Security, we have a break-in. Get the...

8
00:03:29,840 --> 00:03:32,560
I know who you are.
I know what you think...

9
00:03:32,640 --> 00:03:36,320
If you don't wanna get hurt,
keep your mouth shut and don't move.

10
00:03:36,400 --> 00:03:41,430
The chimps are infected. They're highly
contagious. They've been given an inhibitor.

11
00:03:41,520 --> 00:03:44,830
- Infected with what?
- To cure, you must first understand.

12
00:03:44,920 --> 00:03:47,760
Infected with what?

13
00:03:49,640 --> 00:03:51,440
Rage.

14
00:03:53,080 --> 00:03:56,120
- What is he talking about?
- Get the cages open.

15
00:03:56,200 --> 00:03:57,480
No! No! No!

16
00:03:58,160 --> 00:04:02,280
Listen, you sick bastard,
we're taking your torture victims with us.

17
00:04:02,360 --> 00:04:03,880
We'll get you out of here.

18
00:04:03,960 --> 00:04:08,430
The animals are contagious. The infection
is in their blood and saliva. One bite...

19
00:04:08,520 --> 00:04:10,910
Stop... Stop! You've no idea!

20
00:04:17,200 --> 00:04:19,920
Get it off! Help me!

21
00:04:25,080 --> 00:04:27,120
Get it off! Get it off!

22
00:04:30,600 --> 00:04:33,670
- What's the matter with her?
- You have to kill her!

23
00:04:35,680 --> 00:04:37,830
Oh, my God!

24
00:04:42,000 --> 00:04:45,070
- What's the matter with her?
- We have to kill her now!

25
00:04:47,480 --> 00:04:49,000
Oh, God...

26
00:06:33,520 --> 00:06:34,960
Hello?

27
00:07:11,840 --> 00:07:13,280
Hello?

28
00:07:30,680 --> 00:07:32,590
Hello!

29
00:09:10,360 --> 00:09:11,640
Hello?

30
00:09:36,880 --> 00:09:38,320
Hello!

31
00:14:18,680 --> 00:14:20,670
Hello?

32
00:14:28,360 --> 00:14:30,350
Hello?

33
00:14:44,120 --> 00:14:46,110
Father?

34
00:14:52,280 --> 00:14:54,270
Father, are you OK?

35
00:15:01,320 --> 00:15:03,880
Oh, shouldn't have done that.

36
00:15:04,280 --> 00:15:06,430
Shouldn't have done that.

37
00:15:06,840 --> 00:15:08,640
Shit!

38
00:15:34,320 --> 00:15:36,360
Over here!

39
00:15:39,120 --> 00:15:41,350
- Over here!
- Come on!

40
00:15:53,320 --> 00:15:55,680
Go, go, go!

41
00:16:00,720 --> 00:16:01,760
Keep going!

42
00:16:01,840 --> 00:16:04,600
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just shut up!

43
00:16:12,400 --> 00:16:14,870
- Covered everything.
- Who are those people?

44
00:16:41,080 --> 00:16:42,280
Let's go! Let's go!

45
00:16:42,360 --> 00:16:44,510
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just move!

46
00:16:52,960 --> 00:16:54,870
Come on!

47
00:17:13,280 --> 00:17:17,830
Man walks into a bar with a giraffe.
They each get pissed.

48
00:17:17,920 --> 00:17:19,830
The giraffe falls over.

49
00:17:19,920 --> 00:17:24,920
The man goes to leave and the barman says
"Oi! You can't leave that lying there."

50
00:17:25,000 --> 00:17:28,880
He says "No, it's not a lion. It's a giraffe".

51
00:17:36,200 --> 00:17:38,960
He's completely humourless.

52
00:17:39,040 --> 00:17:41,840
You two should get on like a house on fire.

53
00:17:43,280 --> 00:17:45,270
So who are you?

54
00:17:46,440 --> 00:17:48,270
You're from the hospital.

55
00:17:48,360 --> 00:17:51,720
- Are you a doctor?
- He's not a doctor. He's a patient.

56
00:17:51,800 --> 00:17:54,030
I'm a bicycle courier.

57
00:17:56,120 --> 00:18:02,280
I was riding a package from Farringdon to
Shaftesbury Avenue and a car cut across me.

58
00:18:02,360 --> 00:18:05,960
Then I wake up today in hospital.
I wake up and I'm...

59
00:18:06,040 --> 00:18:07,870
I'm hallucinating or I'm...

60
00:18:09,480 --> 00:18:11,840
What's your name?

61
00:18:11,920 --> 00:18:13,910
Jim.

62
00:18:14,560 --> 00:18:17,120
I'm Mark. This is Selena.

63
00:18:21,360 --> 00:18:22,950
OK, Jim.

64
00:18:27,960 --> 00:18:30,400
I've got some bad news.

65
00:18:30,480 --> 00:18:36,480
It started as rioting, and right from
the beginning you knew this was different.

66
00:18:36,560 --> 00:18:40,560
Because it was happening
in small villages, market towns.

67
00:18:41,400 --> 00:18:44,040
And then it wasn't on the TV any more.

68
00:18:44,120 --> 00:18:48,640
It was in the street outside.
It was coming through your windows.

69
00:18:48,720 --> 00:18:50,470
It was a virus.

70
00:18:50,560 --> 00:18:52,280
An infection.

71
00:18:52,360 --> 00:18:55,080
You didn't need a doctor to tell you that.

72
00:18:55,160 --> 00:18:57,520
It was the blood.

73
00:18:57,600 --> 00:18:59,990
There was something in the blood.

74
00:19:01,400 --> 00:19:06,160
By the time they tried to evacuate
the cities, it was already too late.

75
00:19:06,240 --> 00:19:09,040
The infection was everywhere.

76
00:19:09,120 --> 00:19:11,510
The army blockades were overrun.

77
00:19:13,000 --> 00:19:15,600
And that's when the exodus started.

78
00:19:16,920 --> 00:19:19,560
The day before broadcasting stopped,

79
00:19:19,640 --> 00:19:23,160
there were reports of Infection
in Paris and New York.

80
00:19:25,440 --> 00:19:28,240
We didn't hear anything more after that.

81
00:19:31,080 --> 00:19:33,920
- What's the government doing?
- There's no government.

82
00:19:34,000 --> 00:19:36,360
Of course there's a government!

83
00:19:36,440 --> 00:19:40,360
There's always a government.
They're in a bunker or a plane...

84
00:19:40,440 --> 00:19:44,560
No, there's no government,
no police, no army.

85
00:19:45,960 --> 00:19:48,920
No TV, no radio, no electricity.

86
00:19:49,520 --> 00:19:53,520
You're the first uninfected person
we've seen in six days.

87
00:19:54,320 --> 00:19:56,310
Where's your family?

88
00:19:57,200 --> 00:19:59,160
They're dead. Like Selena's.

89
00:19:59,240 --> 00:20:01,280
Yours will be dead too.

90
00:20:11,160 --> 00:20:15,000
Look, I have to find them.
They live in Deptford. I can walk it. OK?

91
00:20:15,080 --> 00:20:17,550
You'll go and come back, yeah?

92
00:20:19,440 --> 00:20:21,590
- You won't.
- Yes!

93
00:20:21,680 --> 00:20:24,560
No one ever comes back.

94
00:20:28,880 --> 00:20:30,870
So lesson one.

95
00:20:31,720 --> 00:20:35,950
You never go anywhere alone
unless you've got no choice.

96
00:20:36,040 --> 00:20:38,270
Lesson two.

97
00:20:38,360 --> 00:20:42,280
Only travel during daylight.
Unless you've got no choice.

98
00:20:44,240 --> 00:20:46,200
We'll take you tomorrow.

99
00:20:46,280 --> 00:20:49,720
We'll all go and find
your dead parents together, OK?

100
00:20:50,720 --> 00:20:52,120
Eat.

101
00:21:03,800 --> 00:21:06,840
If you want her to slow down,
you'll have to say.

102
00:21:32,640 --> 00:21:34,230
- If there's anyone...
- I understand.

103
00:21:34,320 --> 00:21:36,310
- Anyone...
- I understand!

104
00:21:38,360 --> 00:21:39,840
OK.

105
00:22:19,920 --> 00:22:21,200
Jim...

106
00:22:22,000 --> 00:22:23,280
Wait!

107
00:23:44,480 --> 00:23:48,270
They died peacefully.
You should be grateful.

108
00:23:48,360 --> 00:23:50,670
I'm not grateful.

109
00:23:51,880 --> 00:23:53,790
My...

110
00:23:54,480 --> 00:23:58,790
parents and my sister,
we went to Paddington Station,

111
00:24:01,320 --> 00:24:06,440
hoping maybe we could get on a plane,
maybe we could buy our way onto a plane.

112
00:24:07,040 --> 00:24:09,320
I remember my dad had all this cash,

113
00:24:09,400 --> 00:24:12,600
even though cash was completely useless.

114
00:24:14,080 --> 00:24:17,070
About 20,000 other people had the same idea.

115
00:24:19,480 --> 00:24:21,600
Crowd was surging.

116
00:24:22,400 --> 00:24:24,630
I lost my grip on my sister's hand.

117
00:24:26,720 --> 00:24:28,950
I remember the ground was soft.

118
00:24:30,840 --> 00:24:35,040
I looked down
and I was standing on all these people.

119
00:24:35,120 --> 00:24:38,910
Like a carpet. People who had fallen and...

120
00:24:39,000 --> 00:24:42,790
Somewhere in the crowd
there were Infected. It spread fast.

121
00:24:42,880 --> 00:24:46,080
No one could run.
All you could do was climb.

122
00:24:47,640 --> 00:24:50,600
Climb over more people.
So I did that. I climbed.

123
00:24:50,680 --> 00:24:52,960
And I got up on top of this kiosk.

124
00:24:55,160 --> 00:24:59,920
Looking down, you couldn't tell
which faces were infected and which weren't.

125
00:25:00,000 --> 00:25:03,710
Then I saw my dad.
Not my mum or my sister.

126
00:25:03,800 --> 00:25:05,680
My dad.

127
00:25:07,880 --> 00:25:09,870
His face...

128
00:25:13,400 --> 00:25:17,160
Selena's right.
You should be grateful.

129
00:25:17,240 --> 00:25:22,190
We don't have time to get back to the shop
before dark. We should stay here tonight.

130
00:25:24,760 --> 00:25:27,480
My room's up at the top.
You two can have that.

131
00:25:27,560 --> 00:25:30,760
No, we'll all sleep in the same room. It's safer.

132
00:26:47,760 --> 00:26:49,750
Jim.

133
00:26:58,080 --> 00:27:00,070
- You're back.
- Yeah.

134
00:27:06,200 --> 00:27:08,190
- How was it?
- Fine.

135
00:27:09,240 --> 00:27:11,440
Give me a drink of that, will ya?

136
00:27:11,520 --> 00:27:13,510
- It's empty.
- Ha!

137
00:27:15,720 --> 00:27:17,950
Here.

138
00:27:19,960 --> 00:27:21,950
I'll start working on them, then.

139
00:27:28,320 --> 00:27:30,230
Mark! Mark!

140
00:27:31,000 --> 00:27:33,040
Selena! Help!

141
00:27:46,800 --> 00:27:48,790
It's clear.

142
00:27:54,040 --> 00:27:56,880
- That's Mr Bridges.
- Were you bitten?

143
00:27:56,960 --> 00:27:59,080
And his daughter. From four doors down.

144
00:27:59,160 --> 00:28:02,120
- Were you bitten?
- No.

145
00:28:02,200 --> 00:28:05,000
Did any of the blood get in your mouth?

146
00:28:05,880 --> 00:28:07,790
No.

147
00:28:10,800 --> 00:28:12,470
Mark?

148
00:28:14,800 --> 00:28:16,440
Wait...

149
00:28:37,400 --> 00:28:39,520
Get that cleaned off.

150
00:28:41,320 --> 00:28:43,310
Do you have any clothes here?

151
00:28:44,400 --> 00:28:46,200
Um... I... Yes.

152
00:28:46,280 --> 00:28:49,800
Then get them and get dressed.
We have to leave now.

153
00:28:49,880 --> 00:28:53,400
More Infected will be coming.
They always do.

154
00:29:21,000 --> 00:29:23,880
How did you know?
How did you know he was infected?

155
00:29:23,960 --> 00:29:27,720
- The blood.
- There was blood on me. It was on you.

156
00:29:27,800 --> 00:29:32,960
I didn't know he was infected.
He knew. I could see it in his face.

157
00:29:33,040 --> 00:29:37,270
If someone gets infected,
you've about 20 seconds to kill them.

158
00:29:37,360 --> 00:29:42,280
It might be your brother, your sister
or your oldest friend. It makes no difference.

159
00:29:42,360 --> 00:29:47,560
Just so you know where you stand,
if it happens to you, I'll do it in a heartbeat.

160
00:29:47,640 --> 00:29:51,680
He was full of plans.
Have you got any plans, Jim?

161
00:29:51,760 --> 00:29:56,040
Do you want us to find a cure and
save the world or just fall in love and fuck?

162
00:29:56,120 --> 00:29:58,510
Plans are pointless.

163
00:29:58,600 --> 00:30:01,070
Staying alive's as good as it gets.

164
00:30:02,840 --> 00:30:04,200
Hey, hey, hey, hey.

165
00:30:04,280 --> 00:30:06,270
What's that?

166
00:30:12,120 --> 00:30:14,110
Let's go.

167
00:30:57,400 --> 00:31:00,390
What is it about tower blocks
and shopping trolleys?

168
00:31:00,480 --> 00:31:03,440
Stop talking. It's a long way up.

169
00:31:12,760 --> 00:31:14,990
Do you need a break?

170
00:31:16,160 --> 00:31:18,070
- You?
- No.

171
00:31:20,640 --> 00:31:22,630
Now I do need a break.

172
00:31:32,680 --> 00:31:34,430
What's up?

173
00:31:34,520 --> 00:31:36,430
Nothin'.

174
00:31:38,720 --> 00:31:40,000
I got a headache.

175
00:31:40,080 --> 00:31:41,520
- Bad?
- Pretty bad.

176
00:31:41,600 --> 00:31:46,680
- Why didn't you say something before?
- I didn't think you'd give a shit.

177
00:31:47,840 --> 00:31:51,920
You've got no fat on you
and all you've had to eat is sugar.

178
00:31:52,000 --> 00:31:54,040
So you're crashing.

179
00:31:54,120 --> 00:31:56,270
There isn't a lot we can do about that

180
00:31:56,360 --> 00:32:01,230
except pump you full of painkillers
and give you more sugar. As for sugar,

181
00:32:01,320 --> 00:32:03,520
Pepsi or Lilt?

182
00:32:04,720 --> 00:32:06,630
Do you have any Tango?

183
00:32:06,720 --> 00:32:09,630
Actually,
I did have a can of Tango somewhere.

184
00:32:10,800 --> 00:32:12,950
Quiet! That's an Infected.

185
00:32:22,880 --> 00:32:24,630
Oh no, they're in. Move!

186
00:32:27,600 --> 00:32:30,040
Wait up, Selena!

187
00:32:30,920 --> 00:32:32,830
Wait for me, please!

188
00:32:32,920 --> 00:32:34,960
Please, Selena! Please!

189
00:32:35,040 --> 00:32:37,270
- Wait for me!
- Come on!

190
00:32:37,360 --> 00:32:39,270
- Run!
- Wait!

191
00:32:39,880 --> 00:32:42,480
Please! For fuck's sake!

192
00:32:43,040 --> 00:32:45,190
- Selena!

193
00:32:46,840 --> 00:32:50,070
Down the corridor. Flat 157. Move!

194
00:32:50,160 --> 00:32:52,150
Thank you. Thank you.

195
00:33:04,120 --> 00:33:06,080
Open the door!

196
00:33:11,440 --> 00:33:12,960
Open the door!

197
00:33:17,480 --> 00:33:19,870
- Open up!
- Where's Dad?

198
00:33:19,960 --> 00:33:21,360
What?

199
00:33:23,840 --> 00:33:26,720
- Open the fucking door!
- Where's Dad?

200
00:33:26,800 --> 00:33:29,000
Let them in, Hannah. Let them inside.

201
00:33:36,600 --> 00:33:38,800
Go in. Go in!

202
00:33:56,080 --> 00:33:58,440
So, I'm Frank, anyway.

203
00:33:58,520 --> 00:34:00,240
Jim.

204
00:34:01,040 --> 00:34:04,000
- Selena.
- Selena. Good to meet you.

205
00:34:04,080 --> 00:34:06,280
This is my daughter Hannah.

206
00:34:06,360 --> 00:34:08,510
Come on, sweetheart. Say hello.

207
00:34:09,880 --> 00:34:11,870
Come on.

208
00:34:12,600 --> 00:34:14,480
So...

209
00:34:14,560 --> 00:34:16,390
This is great. Just great.

210
00:34:18,640 --> 00:34:20,840
Calls for a celebration, I'd say.

211
00:34:20,920 --> 00:34:23,830
Why don't you all sit down and...

212
00:34:23,920 --> 00:34:26,760
Hannah, what have we got to offer?

213
00:34:26,840 --> 00:34:29,230
We've got Mum's creme de menthe.

214
00:34:29,320 --> 00:34:31,920
Great. Creme de menthe.

215
00:34:32,000 --> 00:34:34,600
Oh, yeah. Look, sit, please.

216
00:34:34,680 --> 00:34:37,040
Get comfortable.

217
00:34:39,760 --> 00:34:42,640
- Where are the bloody glasses?
- Middle cupboard.

218
00:34:42,720 --> 00:34:45,480
Nah, the good ones. It's a celebration.

219
00:34:45,560 --> 00:34:47,950
Top cupboard.

220
00:34:48,040 --> 00:34:50,640
So this is your place?

221
00:34:51,840 --> 00:34:53,510
It's nice.

222
00:35:06,160 --> 00:35:07,230
There.

223
00:35:07,320 --> 00:35:10,280
I know it isn't much but, well, cheers.

224
00:35:10,360 --> 00:35:12,030
Cheers.

225
00:35:32,680 --> 00:35:34,670
You OK in there, Jim?

226
00:35:35,600 --> 00:35:37,830
Yeah.

227
00:35:37,920 --> 00:35:43,280
Sorry we couldn't spare the water.
Same with the toilet. The flush doesn't work.

228
00:35:44,880 --> 00:35:47,030
You'll have to use the bucket.

229
00:35:53,320 --> 00:35:55,840
Have to empty it each morning.

230
00:35:55,920 --> 00:35:59,440
Just chuck it over the balcony.
No mod cons here.

231
00:35:59,520 --> 00:36:01,160
It's fine.

232
00:36:01,240 --> 00:36:04,230
Listen, it's late. We're gonna turn in.

233
00:36:05,840 --> 00:36:08,120
We have a spare room.

234
00:36:09,120 --> 00:36:10,350
In there.

235
00:36:10,440 --> 00:36:12,320
Are you and Selena...?

236
00:36:13,520 --> 00:36:15,270
No. No, no, no.

237
00:36:15,360 --> 00:36:16,950
Um...

238
00:36:17,040 --> 00:36:19,320
I'll take the living room. It's fine.

239
00:36:19,400 --> 00:36:21,200
Right.

240
00:36:22,040 --> 00:36:24,030
No, I mean, yeah.

241
00:36:25,040 --> 00:36:26,950
So, um...

242
00:36:27,960 --> 00:36:30,840
- Goodnight, then.
- Yeah. Goodnight, Frank.

243
00:36:44,880 --> 00:36:46,360
Very spruce.

244
00:36:47,640 --> 00:36:50,360
- Very shredded.
- Yeah.

245
00:36:54,520 --> 00:36:58,070
- So what do you make of them?
- Well, they're desperate.

246
00:36:59,160 --> 00:37:01,880
Probably need us more than we need them.

247
00:37:03,280 --> 00:37:05,430
I think they're good people.

248
00:37:08,160 --> 00:37:11,000
- Good people?
- Yeah.

249
00:37:12,720 --> 00:37:17,190
You should be more concerned about
whether they're gonna slow you down.

250
00:37:17,280 --> 00:37:20,880
- Because if they slowed you down...
- I'd leave them behind.

251
00:37:20,960 --> 00:37:22,790
- In a heartbeat.
- Yeah.

252
00:37:23,480 --> 00:37:25,070
I wouldn't.

253
00:37:25,160 --> 00:37:28,550
Then you're gonna wind up
getting yourself killed.

254
00:37:36,560 --> 00:37:38,950
I'm gonna get some sleep.

255
00:37:41,360 --> 00:37:43,160
Selena...

256
00:37:43,960 --> 00:37:47,080
You think I don't get it, but I do get it.

257
00:37:48,880 --> 00:37:52,720
And I know I'd be dead already
if I hadn't met you.

258
00:37:53,200 --> 00:37:54,720
Sure.

259
00:37:54,800 --> 00:37:56,320
No, look...

260
00:37:58,600 --> 00:38:00,590
I mean, thank you.

261
00:38:03,640 --> 00:38:05,710
And I mean, sure.

262
00:38:05,800 --> 00:38:08,480
Goodnight, Jim.

263
00:38:08,560 --> 00:38:10,550
Goodnight.

264
00:38:23,600 --> 00:38:25,590
We lost water pressure three weeks ago.

265
00:38:25,680 --> 00:38:29,640
I thought we'd be OK with the water
from the other flats. Cisterns and tanks.

266
00:38:29,720 --> 00:38:32,790
But it vanishes so quick
you wouldn't believe.

267
00:38:35,960 --> 00:38:37,600
You drink it,

268
00:38:37,680 --> 00:38:39,400
it evaporates,

269
00:38:39,480 --> 00:38:41,470
turns stagnant.

270
00:38:43,760 --> 00:38:45,750
They're all empty.

271
00:38:46,600 --> 00:38:48,510
Hasn't rained in ten days.

272
00:38:48,600 --> 00:38:52,680
You can set up a plastic sheet
to catch dew and condensation.

273
00:38:52,760 --> 00:38:56,360
Saw it on TV once, but I can't make it work.

274
00:38:57,640 --> 00:38:59,630
You'd never think it.

275
00:39:00,520 --> 00:39:03,360
Needing rain so badly.

276
00:39:04,960 --> 00:39:07,270
Not in fucking England!

277
00:39:11,760 --> 00:39:14,750
Jim, we're not going to be able to stay here.

278
00:39:23,320 --> 00:39:26,920
- There's been no broadcasts for weeks.
- Just listen.

279
00:39:27,000 --> 00:39:31,390
Salvation is here.
The answer to Infection is here.

280
00:39:31,480 --> 00:39:34,360
if you can hear this, you're not alone.

281
00:39:34,440 --> 00:39:38,750
There are others like you.
There are other survivors.

282
00:39:38,840 --> 00:39:40,960
We are soldiers and we are armed.

283
00:39:41,040 --> 00:39:44,190
Oh, my God. Soldiers.

284
00:39:44,280 --> 00:39:48,670
- Quiet. There's more.
- Our location is the 42nd blockade, M602,

285
00:39:48,760 --> 00:39:52,040
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

286
00:39:52,120 --> 00:39:55,880
- You must find us. Salvation is...
- Now it just repeats.

287
00:39:55,960 --> 00:39:58,240
- It's a recording?
- Yeah, it's a recording.

288
00:39:58,320 --> 00:40:01,120
But this is where it's telling us to go.

289
00:40:01,200 --> 00:40:03,270
Just there.

290
00:40:04,720 --> 00:40:09,320
The way things are, we might need
two or three days to get up there.

291
00:40:09,400 --> 00:40:11,040
"We"?

292
00:40:14,960 --> 00:40:20,800
Sound carries in this flat. Me and Hannah
do need you more than you need us.

293
00:40:20,880 --> 00:40:23,920
- Look, I didn't...
- No, it's OK. It's the truth.

294
00:40:24,000 --> 00:40:26,390
I can't leave the block if it's the two of us.

295
00:40:26,480 --> 00:40:30,270
Something might happen to me.
Hannah'd be alone. I couldn't risk it.

296
00:40:30,360 --> 00:40:32,000
But with other people...

297
00:40:32,080 --> 00:40:36,200
If it's a recording,
the soldiers who made it could be dead.

298
00:40:36,280 --> 00:40:39,640
- It's possible.
- That stuff about the answer to Infection...

299
00:40:39,720 --> 00:40:43,840
There is no answer!
It's already done all the damage it can!

300
00:40:43,920 --> 00:40:46,640
- Maybe they have a cure.
- Maybe they've got nothing.

301
00:40:46,720 --> 00:40:50,640
- The only way to find out is to reach them.
- We could die trying, Frank!

302
00:40:52,640 --> 00:40:54,840
Or die here.

303
00:40:54,920 --> 00:41:00,390
And anyway, it isn't true what Dad said.
You need us just the same as we need you.

304
00:41:01,840 --> 00:41:03,640
We need each other.

305
00:41:03,720 --> 00:41:08,800
And we'll never be safe in the cities.
The soldiers could keep us safe.

306
00:41:09,480 --> 00:41:11,470
So we have to try and get there.

307
00:41:12,560 --> 00:41:14,080
Get there how?

308
00:41:25,040 --> 00:41:28,640
Just so you know,
I don't take cheques or credit cards.

309
00:41:56,040 --> 00:41:58,920
- What do you think?
- It's the most direct route.

310
00:41:59,000 --> 00:42:04,030
Then we should take the indirect route.
The one in daylight and not underground.

311
00:42:04,120 --> 00:42:06,350
Let's just get it done.

312
00:42:18,760 --> 00:42:20,830
No, no.

313
00:42:20,920 --> 00:42:23,310
No. See, this is a really shit idea.

314
00:42:24,160 --> 00:42:27,390
You know why?
Because it's obviously a shit idea.

315
00:42:27,480 --> 00:42:31,680
So we're gonna drive into the tunnel
full of fucking smashed cars...

316
00:42:31,760 --> 00:42:34,560
It's really fucking obviously a shit idea!

317
00:42:34,640 --> 00:42:36,790
Hold on!

318
00:42:45,600 --> 00:42:47,400
Dad!

319
00:43:06,040 --> 00:43:07,520
Fuck!

320
00:43:08,760 --> 00:43:11,070
The world's worst place to get a flat.

321
00:43:11,160 --> 00:43:14,360
Agreed. I think we'd better do this quick.

322
00:43:16,760 --> 00:43:18,830
I've got the wheel. You're on the jack.

323
00:43:32,840 --> 00:43:36,230
Do you hear that?
Hey, hey, do you hear that?

324
00:43:36,320 --> 00:43:38,310
Hear what?

325
00:43:38,960 --> 00:43:41,160
Right, I've done it.

326
00:43:42,680 --> 00:43:44,080
Dad?

327
00:43:47,800 --> 00:43:50,760
- Jesus Christ!

328
00:43:50,840 --> 00:43:52,320
Fucking rats!

329
00:44:02,440 --> 00:44:04,910
They're running from the Infected.

330
00:44:05,000 --> 00:44:06,830
Move it!

331
00:44:06,920 --> 00:44:11,040
Forget the jack, Hannah.
There's no time. Just lift, everyone.

332
00:44:11,120 --> 00:44:14,240
Grab hold! One, two, three, lift!

333
00:44:18,040 --> 00:44:19,920
Lift, lift!

334
00:44:20,440 --> 00:44:25,360
- Don't look at them! Don't look!
- I can see them! They're coming!

335
00:44:30,840 --> 00:44:33,310
Come on, Hannah!

336
00:44:33,400 --> 00:44:35,710
Almost.

337
00:44:35,800 --> 00:44:38,600
- Get the tyre on, Hannah!
- I'm trying.

338
00:44:43,200 --> 00:44:45,760
Three, two, one,

339
00:44:45,840 --> 00:44:47,480
drop it!

340
00:44:51,440 --> 00:44:53,800
- Get in the car!
- Come on!

341
00:44:55,800 --> 00:44:58,080
- Frank, drive!
- Move it, Frank!

342
00:45:00,880 --> 00:45:02,870
Whoo!

343
00:45:07,480 --> 00:45:09,470
Goodbye, you fuckers!

344
00:45:17,120 --> 00:45:19,320
Frank, stop the cab.

345
00:45:41,360 --> 00:45:43,560
Let's shop.

346
00:45:53,760 --> 00:45:55,200
You...

347
00:45:55,960 --> 00:45:57,400
You...

348
00:45:58,200 --> 00:45:59,240
You...

349
00:45:59,320 --> 00:46:01,790
Anybody seen any buns?

350
00:46:01,880 --> 00:46:04,560
Hmm. Irradiated.

351
00:46:07,160 --> 00:46:10,600
Don't take anything
that needs to be cooked, OK?

352
00:46:10,680 --> 00:46:12,430
I think you can eat that raw.

353
00:46:12,520 --> 00:46:14,320
Decaffeinated coffee...

354
00:46:14,400 --> 00:46:16,390
Put that back.

355
00:46:17,560 --> 00:46:19,710
CanÂ’t just take any crap.

356
00:46:19,800 --> 00:46:24,110
If I never see another chocolate bar again,
it'll be too soon.

357
00:46:24,520 --> 00:46:27,080
Not counting Terry's Chocolate Orange!

358
00:46:28,640 --> 00:46:32,110
Now, single malt,
16-year-old, dark, full flavour.

359
00:46:33,040 --> 00:46:34,920
Warm but not aggressive.

360
00:46:35,000 --> 00:46:38,360
- Peaty aftertaste.

361
00:46:39,880 --> 00:46:43,000
Takes out the fire but leaves in the warmth.

362
00:47:35,640 --> 00:47:38,600
Either we do this now or we're walking.

363
00:47:45,320 --> 00:47:47,310
Not you.

364
00:47:50,520 --> 00:47:52,720
- Stay close, Jim.
- What?

365
00:47:52,800 --> 00:47:54,790
You heard.

366
00:48:20,280 --> 00:48:22,270
Where are you going?

367
00:48:23,320 --> 00:48:25,630
We've got enough food, Jim.

368
00:48:25,720 --> 00:48:27,950
We don't have any cheeseburgers.

369
00:48:28,680 --> 00:48:31,240
Like going on holidays
with your aunt!

370
00:49:08,840 --> 00:49:11,200
Oh, Jesus.

371
00:49:35,960 --> 00:49:37,440
Hello?

372
00:49:50,680 --> 00:49:52,400
I hate you!

373
00:50:01,200 --> 00:50:03,190
Find anything?

374
00:50:05,360 --> 00:50:08,040
- Find anything, Jim?
- No! Let's get outta here.

375
00:50:08,120 --> 00:50:10,110
OK, we're done here.

376
00:50:12,240 --> 00:50:14,040
OK, Hannah.

377
00:50:21,120 --> 00:50:22,710
Easy. Brake!

378
00:50:22,800 --> 00:50:24,790
Brake, brake!

379
00:50:32,320 --> 00:50:34,310
Out.

380
00:51:17,080 --> 00:51:20,150
Mmmm! Oh my God!

381
00:51:20,880 --> 00:51:23,760
I can, like, taste the vitamin C.

382
00:51:24,560 --> 00:51:27,240
Mmmm, the raisins are so moist.

383
00:51:28,400 --> 00:51:30,390
What did you say?

384
00:51:30,480 --> 00:51:33,160
The raisins. They're so moist.

385
00:51:37,720 --> 00:51:39,710
Look over here.

386
00:51:50,560 --> 00:51:52,310
Like a family.

387
00:51:52,400 --> 00:51:54,760
Do you think they're infected?

388
00:51:55,160 --> 00:51:57,150
No.

389
00:52:00,480 --> 00:52:03,080
They're doing just fine.

390
00:52:08,600 --> 00:52:10,590
Come on. Let's eat!

391
00:52:24,680 --> 00:52:25,960
Know what I was thinking?

392
00:52:26,040 --> 00:52:29,590
That you'll never hear
another piece of original music again.

393
00:52:29,680 --> 00:52:33,680
You'll never read a book
that hasn't already been written,

394
00:52:34,680 --> 00:52:38,360
or see a film that hasn't already been shot.

395
00:52:42,680 --> 00:52:45,800
Um... that's what you were thinking.

396
00:52:45,880 --> 00:52:47,680
No.

397
00:52:48,880 --> 00:52:51,080
I was thinking I was wrong.

398
00:52:52,280 --> 00:52:54,270
About what?

399
00:52:55,920 --> 00:52:57,910
All the death.

400
00:52:58,480 --> 00:53:00,470
All this shit.

401
00:53:02,040 --> 00:53:06,350
It doesn't really mean anything
to Frank and Hannah because...

402
00:53:07,680 --> 00:53:10,990
Well, she's got her dad
and he's got his daughter. So...

403
00:53:11,080 --> 00:53:13,120
Cheeky monkey!

404
00:53:13,560 --> 00:53:17,030
I was wrong when I said
staying alive is as good as it gets.

405
00:53:20,520 --> 00:53:22,910
See, that's what I was thinking.

406
00:53:23,400 --> 00:53:24,990
Was it?

407
00:53:25,080 --> 00:53:27,280
Mm. You stole my thought.

408
00:53:32,280 --> 00:53:34,080
Sorry.

409
00:53:35,000 --> 00:53:36,800
That's OK.

410
00:53:36,880 --> 00:53:38,870
You can keep it.

411
00:53:39,960 --> 00:53:43,800
It's getting late.
We'd better stay here for the night.

412
00:53:58,240 --> 00:54:00,680
I can't sleep.

413
00:54:00,760 --> 00:54:03,280
Me neither.

414
00:54:03,360 --> 00:54:05,640
Doesn't feel safe, does it?

415
00:54:05,720 --> 00:54:07,710
Outside like this.

416
00:54:08,560 --> 00:54:10,870
I think we're safe enough.

417
00:54:10,960 --> 00:54:13,520
Selena didn't seem to have any trouble.

418
00:54:14,200 --> 00:54:16,590
Yeah, I noticed that.

419
00:54:16,680 --> 00:54:18,120
Hey, Selena...

420
00:54:18,200 --> 00:54:20,190
What? What is it?

421
00:54:21,480 --> 00:54:23,440
How'd you get to sleep?

422
00:54:29,640 --> 00:54:33,350
Bloody hell. Must've needed
a hell of a prescription for that lot.

423
00:54:33,440 --> 00:54:37,560
I didn't need a prescription.
I qualified as a chemist.

424
00:54:37,640 --> 00:54:40,080
Oh, great. Valium.

425
00:54:40,160 --> 00:54:42,630
Not only will we be able to get to sleep

426
00:54:42,720 --> 00:54:46,270
but if we're attacked in the middle
of the night, we won't even care.

427
00:54:46,360 --> 00:54:48,510
- Two each.
- Not for me, thanks.

428
00:54:48,600 --> 00:54:50,560
Can I, Dad?

429
00:54:50,640 --> 00:54:52,550
I don't think so, sweetheart.

430
00:54:52,640 --> 00:54:54,080
Please?

431
00:54:55,520 --> 00:54:57,510
- No.
- I can't sleep.

432
00:55:00,480 --> 00:55:03,080
Come on, Frank. Let her live a little.

433
00:55:04,120 --> 00:55:07,960
- Give her half of one.
- All right. We're on.

434
00:55:18,200 --> 00:55:20,080
Night-night.

435
00:55:20,840 --> 00:55:23,360
You're a big softie, Frank.

436
00:55:52,720 --> 00:55:54,600
Frank?

437
00:55:54,680 --> 00:55:56,670
Hannah?

438
00:55:56,760 --> 00:55:58,560
Frank?

439
00:56:03,960 --> 00:56:05,950
Hello? Hello!

440
00:56:06,960 --> 00:56:08,160
Hello!

441
00:56:08,240 --> 00:56:10,630
Hello! Hello!

442
00:56:18,400 --> 00:56:20,390
Shh...

443
00:56:21,720 --> 00:56:24,400
You're having a bad dream, that's all.

444
00:56:27,040 --> 00:56:29,030
Thanks, Dad.

445
00:57:02,880 --> 00:57:05,350
Come on, sleepyhead.

446
00:57:08,880 --> 00:57:10,870
Come on, Babe Ruth.

447
00:57:13,960 --> 00:57:15,760
Hurry up.

448
00:57:17,440 --> 00:57:20,800
- Did I miss breakfast?
- You'll sleep through anything.

449
00:57:20,880 --> 00:57:25,670
- Did you have a fry-up?
- We'll stop at a pub on the way. Door!

450
00:57:49,240 --> 00:57:53,550
Our location is the
42nd blockade, the M602,

451
00:57:53,640 --> 00:57:56,600
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

452
00:57:56,680 --> 00:57:58,510
You must find us. Please!

453
00:57:58,600 --> 00:58:00,640
Salvation is here.

454
00:58:00,720 --> 00:58:03,630
The answer to Infection is here.

455
00:58:34,360 --> 00:58:36,350
Must be Manchester.

456
00:58:38,480 --> 00:58:41,710
The whole of Manchester, the whole city.

457
00:58:43,480 --> 00:58:45,710
No fire crews to put it out.

458
00:59:38,280 --> 00:59:40,750
42nd blockade.

459
00:59:40,840 --> 00:59:43,070
This is it.

460
01:00:51,320 --> 01:00:55,160
I don't understand, Dad.
Did they leave?

461
01:00:55,240 --> 01:00:58,230
- I don't like this. I think we should go.
- No!

462
01:01:04,800 --> 01:01:09,430
Vehicles. We should check the vehicles.
There has to be something.

463
01:01:26,840 --> 01:01:28,670
Nothing.

464
01:01:28,760 --> 01:01:30,590
I can't believe it.

465
01:01:30,680 --> 01:01:32,560
Frank...

466
01:01:33,000 --> 01:01:34,800
Frank!

467
01:01:36,920 --> 01:01:38,510
- We have to go.
- Yeah.

468
01:01:38,600 --> 01:01:40,990
Go fucking where?!

469
01:02:18,520 --> 01:02:20,590
Get out of it.

470
01:02:23,960 --> 01:02:25,950
Get out of it!

471
01:02:43,040 --> 01:02:45,510
Dad, are you all right?

472
01:02:45,600 --> 01:02:48,160
Yeah, I'm fine, sweetheart.

473
01:02:49,040 --> 01:02:51,640
Sorry I lost my temper.

474
01:02:51,720 --> 01:02:53,760
Hannah...

475
01:02:53,840 --> 01:02:56,680
I love you very much.

476
01:02:56,760 --> 01:02:58,670
- What?
- Keep away from me.

477
01:02:58,760 --> 01:03:00,990
Stay where you are.

478
01:03:01,080 --> 01:03:03,880
- Dad?
- Keep away from me! Keep away from me!

479
01:03:03,960 --> 01:03:06,350
Keep away! Keep away! Keep away!

480
01:03:06,440 --> 01:03:09,430
- Dad!
- Keep away! Keep away!

481
01:03:10,880 --> 01:03:13,520
What's wrong? Dad!

482
01:03:17,640 --> 01:03:19,950
Jim! Jim, he's infected!

483
01:03:20,040 --> 01:03:22,560
- No!
- Now, Jim! Now!

484
01:03:22,640 --> 01:03:25,920
- Jim, kill him! Jim!
- Dad!

485
01:03:26,000 --> 01:03:27,230
Kill him!

486
01:03:35,360 --> 01:03:37,560
Stay away from him!

487
01:03:38,760 --> 01:03:41,070
Keep away from the body!

488
01:03:43,720 --> 01:03:45,520
Dad?

489
01:04:07,000 --> 01:04:09,560
Three survivors. One male, two female.

490
01:04:09,640 --> 01:04:12,840
I repeat, one male, two female.

491
01:04:12,920 --> 01:04:15,390
ETA, 15.

492
01:04:15,480 --> 01:04:17,840
Put the kettle on.

493
01:05:03,840 --> 01:05:06,230
I'm Major Henry West.

494
01:05:07,440 --> 01:05:09,080
- Welcome.
- Jim.

495
01:05:09,160 --> 01:05:11,070
Hello, Jim.

496
01:05:11,160 --> 01:05:12,830
Hello.

497
01:05:15,000 --> 01:05:19,680
Well, we've got beds with clean sheets
and a boiler that produces hot water.

498
01:05:19,760 --> 01:05:22,070
So you can all have a shower.

499
01:05:22,160 --> 01:05:25,360
You look like you need one. Please.

500
01:05:44,480 --> 01:05:49,480
It ain't funny. I got loads of cooking to do,
you fucking Doris!

501
01:05:50,520 --> 01:05:52,560
Run him over!

502
01:05:55,160 --> 01:05:57,840
How is she doing?

503
01:05:57,920 --> 01:06:00,960
She's lost her dad, Jim. That's how she is.

504
01:06:03,520 --> 01:06:05,910
It's all fucked.

505
01:06:06,000 --> 01:06:07,910
What do you mean?

506
01:06:12,760 --> 01:06:16,200
Oh, don't do that.
Come on, come on, come on.

507
01:06:16,280 --> 01:06:18,270
Hey, don't do that.

508
01:06:19,880 --> 01:06:24,670
Hannah is what Frank says she is. Tough,
strong, and she'll cope just like I'll cope.

509
01:06:24,760 --> 01:06:28,520
- Just like you'll cope.
- I don't want her to have to fucking cope.

510
01:06:29,760 --> 01:06:32,070
I want her to be OK.

511
01:06:33,600 --> 01:06:35,670
When Hannah had her dad it was OK.

512
01:06:35,760 --> 01:06:38,440
It was OK for them and it was OK for us.

513
01:06:41,640 --> 01:06:43,950
Now it's all just fucked.

514
01:07:14,120 --> 01:07:16,840
So you heard our broadcast?

515
01:07:16,920 --> 01:07:20,280
- Yeah, we did.
- We must be a disappointment.

516
01:07:20,360 --> 01:07:26,230
You were hoping for a full brigade. An army
base with helicopters and a field hospital.

517
01:07:28,560 --> 01:07:32,560
- We were just hoping for...
- The answer to Infection.

518
01:07:34,800 --> 01:07:36,790
Yeah.

519
01:07:36,880 --> 01:07:41,190
As I said before, it's here. Though
it may not be quite what you imagined.

520
01:07:41,560 --> 01:07:44,360
- Just feel lucky to have found you.
- You were lucky.

521
01:07:44,440 --> 01:07:47,430
The fire drove hundreds of Infected
out of Manchester.

522
01:07:47,520 --> 01:07:50,480
The surrounding area's teeming with them.

523
01:07:52,160 --> 01:07:54,680
But don't worry.

524
01:07:54,760 --> 01:07:57,150
You're quite safe here.

525
01:08:00,120 --> 01:08:05,750
Flat terrain all round the house. Floodlights
which we've rigged up to a generator.

526

I haven't got any fucking bullets!

781
01:36:04,720 --> 01:36:07,280
Don't fucking leave me!

782
01:36:50,560 --> 01:36:52,230
Come on!

783
01:36:54,120 --> 01:36:56,080
Move!

784
01:36:56,160 --> 01:36:58,680
Move! Move!

785
01:37:01,240 --> 01:37:05,840
It's just you and me now, darlin'.
But don't worry, I'll get you out of here.

786
01:37:05,920 --> 01:37:10,200
Then we'll find a nice little fucking place
somewhere. Just you and me.

787
01:37:10,280 --> 01:37:12,510
And we'll live happy ever after, eh?

788
01:38:14,240 --> 01:38:16,630
That was longer than a heartbeat.

789
01:38:19,360 --> 01:38:21,350
Jim?

790
01:38:30,320 --> 01:38:33,710
Listen. Listen. It's not all fucked.

791
01:38:39,240 --> 01:38:41,630
We're gonna be OK. It's not all fucked.

792
01:38:41,720 --> 01:38:44,920
- I've got to explain something.
- Shut up.

793
01:38:45,640 --> 01:38:47,840
It's gonna be OK.

794
01:38:53,080 --> 01:38:56,520
Hannah, it's OK! He's not infected.

795
01:38:56,600 --> 01:38:58,590
But I thought he was biting you.

796
01:38:58,680 --> 01:39:01,240
I was kissing her. Are you stoned?

797
01:39:01,320 --> 01:39:03,390
- It's a long story.

798
01:39:03,480 --> 01:39:05,520
We have to get out of here. Come on!

799
01:39:08,200 --> 01:39:10,190
Come on! Move!

800
01:39:16,920 --> 01:39:18,990
You killed all my boys.

801
01:39:19,080 --> 01:39:20,670
Wait...

802
01:39:27,760 --> 01:39:29,200
Hannah!

803
01:39:29,280 --> 01:39:30,840
Hannah? Hannah!

804
01:39:32,440 --> 01:39:34,560
Hannah!

805
01:39:50,040 --> 01:39:51,560
Get in.

806
01:40:09,760 --> 01:40:11,480
They're locked.

807
01:40:11,560 --> 01:40:13,870
The gates are locked!

808
01:40:16,400 --> 01:40:18,390
Fucking do it!

809
01:40:39,800 --> 01:40:42,110
Come on, Jim, breathe! Fucking breathe!

810
01:41:02,040 --> 01:41:04,240
Not the curtains as well.

811
01:42:12,000 --> 01:42:14,560
You looked all right in this, you know.

812
01:42:15,720 --> 01:42:17,160
It's coming!

813
01:42:33,160 --> 01:42:35,230
- You definitely heard it?
- Yeah!

814
01:42:35,320 --> 01:42:38,520
- I can't hear anything!
- I told you, I heard it!

815
01:42:58,160 --> 01:42:59,910
Go.

816
01:43:31,720 --> 01:43:34,520
Do you think he saw us this time?
